name: VideoIntelligence
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Video Intelligence.

First, install @google-cloud/video-intelligence with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/video-intelligence

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/video-intelligenceâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var video = require('@google-cloud/video-intelligence')();

Elsewhere

var video = require('@google-cloud/video-intelligence')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/video-intelligence are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: VideoIntelligence
methods.description:
Google Cloud Video Intelligence API makes videos searchable, and discoverable, by extracting metadata with an easy to use REST API. You can now search every moment of every video file in your catalog and find every occurrence as well as its significance. It quickly annotates videos stored in Google Cloud Storage, and helps you identify key nouns entities of your video, and when they occur within the video. Separate signal from noise, by retrieving relevant information at the video, shot or per frame.

This is an auto-generated API

It does not follow the conventions you're familiar with from other parts of our library. A handwritten layer is not yet available.

The example below shows you how to instantiate the generated client. For further documentation, please browse the Video Intelligence .proto files on GitHub.

params.name: options.port
params.description: • The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: options.servicePath
params.description: • The domain name of the API remote host.
